meanings.sent1: The explorers were colonizing the new land by building houses and farms.
meanings.sent2: The early settlers were colonizing the vast wilderness to create a new community.
meanings.sent3: The ants were colonizing the picnic area, claiming it as their own territory.
meanings.sent4: The vines were colonizing the garden, spreading and taking over the flower beds.
meanings.sent5: The bacteria were colonizing the petri dish, multiplying rapidly and covering the surface.

meanings.definition: Settling in and establishing control over a new area.
meanings.sent1: The army was colonizing the enemy's territory, setting up camps and outposts.
meanings.sent2: The pioneers were colonizing the western frontier, taming the wild land.
meanings.sent3: The kids were colonizing the playground, claiming different areas for their games.
meanings.sent4: The weeds were colonizing the garden, taking over and choking out the flowers.
meanings.sent5: The mold was colonizing the damp corner of the basement, spreading its musty smell.

meanings.definition: To send settlers to a new territory to establish political control.
meanings.sent1: The government was colonizing the distant island, sending ships with families and supplies.
meanings.sent2: The empire was colonizing new lands, expanding its influence and power.
meanings.sent3: The birds were colonizing the birdhouse, squabbling over the best spots to nest.
meanings.sent4: The ivy was colonizing the brick wall, climbing and clinging to its surface.
meanings.sent5: The humans were colonizing Mars, building habitats and research stations on the red planet.
